com.bigdata.rdf.sparql.ast.service

Class ServiceRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.rdf.sparql.ast.service.ServiceRegistry

  • public class ServiceRegistry
extends Object
    Registry for service calls.
    See Also:
    Federated Query and Custom Services

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ServiceRegistry getInstance()

      • setDefaultServiceFactory

        public void setDefaultServiceFactory(ServiceFactory defaultServiceFactory)
        Set the default ServiceFactory. This will be used when the serviceURI is not associated with an explicitly registered service. For example, you can use this to control whether or not the service end point is assumed to support SPARQL 1.0 or SPARQL 1.1.
        Parameters:
        defaultServiceFactory - The default ServiceFactory.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null.

      • getDefaultServiceFactory

        public ServiceFactory getDefaultServiceFactory()

      • add

        public final void add(org.openrdf.model.URI serviceURI,
                      ServiceFactory factory)
        Register a service.
        Parameters:
        serviceURI - The service URI.
        factory - The factory to execute calls against that service.

      • remove

        public final boolean remove(org.openrdf.model.URI serviceURI)
        Remove a service from the registry and/or set of known aliases.
        Parameters:
        serviceURI - The URI of the service -or- the URI of an alias registered using addAlias(URI, URI).
        Returns:
        true iff a service for that URI was removed.

      • addAlias

        public final void addAlias(org.openrdf.model.URI serviceURI,
                           org.openrdf.model.URI aliasURI)
        Register one URI as an alias for another.
        Parameters:
        serviceURI - The URI of a service. It is expressly permitted to register an alias for a URI which does not have a registered ServiceFactory. This may be used to alias a remote URI which you want to intercept locally.
        aliasURI - The URI of an alias under which that service may be accessed.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the serviceURI has already been registered as a alias (you must remove(URI) the old alias before you can map it against a different serviceURI).
        IllegalStateException - if the aliasURI has already been registered as a service (you can not mask an existing service registration).

      • addWhitelistURL

        public void addWhitelistURL(String URL)
        Add URL to service whitelist
        Parameters:
        URL - the URL to add

      • removeWhitelistURL

        public void removeWhitelistURL(String URL)
        Remove URL to service whitelist
        Parameters:
        URL - the URL to remove

      • setWhitelistEnabled

        public void setWhitelistEnabled(boolean enable)
        Set whitelist status.
        Parameters:
        enable - true if enabled, false if disabled

      • isWhitelistEnabled

        public boolean isWhitelistEnabled()
        Check if whitelisting is enabled

      • customServices

        public Iterator<CustomServiceFactory> customServices()
        Return an Iterator providing a read-only view of the registered CustomServiceFactorys.

      • get

        public ServiceFactory get(org.openrdf.model.URI serviceURI)
        Return the ServiceFactory for that URI. If the URI is a known alias, then it is resolved before looking up the ServiceFactory.
        Parameters:
        serviceURI - The URI.
        Returns:
        The ServiceFactory if one is registered for that URI.

      • toServiceCall

        public final ServiceCall<? extends Object> toServiceCall(AbstractTripleStore store,
                                                         org.eclipse.jetty.client.HttpClient cm,
                                                         org.openrdf.model.URI serviceURI,
                                                         ServiceNode serviceNode,
                                                         BaseJoinStats stats)
        Resolve a ServiceCall for a service URI. If a ServiceFactory was registered for that serviceURI, then it will be returned. Otherwise getDefaultServiceFactory() is used to obtain the ServiceFactory that will be used to create the ServiceCall object for that end point.
        Parameters:
        store - The AbstractTripleStore.
        cm - The ClientConnectionManager will be used to make remote HTTP connections.
        serviceURI - The as-bound URI of the service end point.
        serviceNode - The AST model of the SERVICE clause.
        Returns:
        A ServiceCall for that service.

      • getServiceFactoryByServiceURI

        public ServiceFactory getServiceFactoryByServiceURI(org.openrdf.model.URI serviceUri)
        Maps a URI to a service factory. If the URI is null or there is no custom service, the default service factory (SPARQL 1.1 service) is returned.
        Parameters:
        serviceUri - the URI for which we look up the service
        Returns:
        the associated service factory or the default service factory as fallback
